New Records: Mitchell Santner was the first New Zealand spinner to take a five-wicket haul in a men's ODI World Cup
Key Match Events: New Zealand won by 99 runs
Matt Henry finishes things, first tempting Sybrand Engelbrecht to pick out Devon Conway, running in from deep square, and then producing a gem which ripped Aryan Dutt's leg stump
Mitchell Santner claims his five-for by trapping Ryan Klein lbw
Sybrand Engelbrecht receives a bizarre reprieve as his dismissal is overturned
Mitchell Santner takes a high return catch to remove Scott Edwards for 30
Colin Ackermann made 69 from 73 balls
Mitchell Santner was pivotal in pushing up New Zealand's total with his 36 not out off just 17 balls in a death-overs onslaught
Mitchell Santner struck again to remove Max O'Dowd, lbw for 16
Daryl Mitchell struck five fours and two huge sixes
New Zealand hung a strong total on half-centuries to Will Young, Tom Latham and Rachin Ravindra, with Daryl Mitchell contributing 48
Roelof van der Merwe, Paul van Meekeren and Aryan Dutt took two wickets apiece and Bas de Leede one
Aryan Dutt removes Tom Latham for 53 off 46 balls
Mitchell Santner claims another wicket to remove Scott Edwards for 30
Glenn Phillips' stay is short-lived as he follows Daryl Mitchell off
Paul van Meekeren strikes with a sublime off-cutter, crashing into the top of off and middle stumps to remove Daryl Mitchell for 48
Rachin Ravindra survived again after he was struck on the right boot by Ryan Klein's dipping yorker
Rachin Ravindra brought up his half-century running two on a misfield at deep point
Roelof van der Merwe struck again for his second wicket with Ravindra caught behind by Edwards
Daryl Mitchell goes big, striking over midwicket off Paul van Meekeren in the 29th over
Will Young made 70 off 80 deliveries
Paul van Meekeren makes inroads for Netherlands this time, ending Will Young's innings on 70 from 80 balls
Ravindra survives Netherlands' missed opportunity
Roelof van der Merwe took Netherlands' first wicket
Devon Conway and Will Young were each unbeaten on 29, off 29 and 31 balls respectively, after a pedestrian start
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands win the toss and bowl first
New Zealand captain Tom Latham says: 'It looks a decent surface, hopefully we can put some runs on the board and defend later on.'
Netherlands: Vikramjit Singh, Max O'Dowd, Colin Ackermann, Bas de Lede, Teja Nidamanuru, Scott Edwards (capt, wk), Sybrand Engelbrecht, Roelof van der Merwe, Ryan Klein, Aryan Dutt, Pau van Meekeren
New Zealand: Devon Conway, Will Young, Rachin Ravindra, Daryl Mitchell, Tom Latham (capt, wk), Glenn Phillips, Mark Chapman, Mitchell Santner, Matt Henry, Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand move to two wins from two games at this tournament
Mitchell Santner was Player of the Match
Colin Ackermann put up a fight with his 69 off 73 but they had too much to do
Miscellaneous Highlights: Netherlands are going to need a record here, chasing 323 to win
Netherlands' highest successful run chase in ODIs is 291 against Zimbabwe in 2019
New Zealand hung a strong total on half-centuries to Will Young, Tom Latham and Rachin Ravindra, with Daryl Mitchell contributing 48
Roelof van der Merwe, Paul van Meekeren and Aryan Dutt took two wickets apiece and Bas de Leede one
Netherlands' task even harder than it might have been after conceding an eye-watering 50 runs off the last three overs
